metamer 0.2.0

Changelog

Source: NEWS.md

metamer 0.3.0

Breaking chances

This version overhauls the code and syntax. It makes it pipe friendly and includes new arguments and changes some of the existing ones.

New features

  • The new stop_if argument replaces the old N argument. This allows for more flexible and complex stopping criteria than just the number of iterations. See ?stop_conditions for a list of implemented functions.

  • The new keep argument replaces the old trim argument.

(see ?stop_conditions).

metamer 0.2.02019-09-18

New features

  • Added fortify() method to plot metamers directly with ‘ggplot2’.

  • The perturbation argument in metamerize() can now be a vector of equal in length to change

  • Multiple minimization functions can be passed to minimize.

  • Added function mean_self_proximity() that computes the inverse of the mean minimum distance between each datapoint. Pass it to minimize if you don’t want it to clump.

  • Small speed improvement.

  • Tweaked annealing algorithm.

metamer 0.1.02019-01-02

  • First release
  • Added a NEWS.md file to track changes to the package.
